text: any guesses when we might get a 1.6 beta?

elements.text: any guesses when we might get a 1.6 beta?

text: Feels like 1.6 is the most anticipated release in a long time! I myself only use nightly because 1.6 is amazing :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Feels like 1.6 is the most anticipated release in a long time! I myself only use nightly because 1.6 is amazing

text: <@US5RA4FK4> for someone who's out of the loop, what are the most anticipated 1.6 features?

elements.text: for someone who's out of the loop, what are the most anticipated 1.6 features?

text:
<@UPKUR1KHB> I am not the best to answer this, I am just a Julia fanboy =) But as I use Makie.jl a lot and often restart Julia, I can use the increased speed to first plot. Also, updating and installing packages look much cooler ;) 
And yeah, nightly is 1.7 ... But as far as I know, not many changes from 1.6 yet? Or is there?

elements.text:
I am not the best to answer this, I am just a Julia fanboy =) But as I use Makie.jl a lot and often restart Julia, I can use the increased speed to first plot. Also, updating and installing packages look much cooler ;) 
And yeah, nightly is 1.7 ... But as far as I know, not many changes from 1.6 yet? Or is there?

text:
> updating and installing packages look much cooler
paralleled precompile, not just cooler as in visual, actually much faster

text: I wish I could figure out how to build it, but I think there is some issue with the LLVM artifact on Windows. <https://julialang.slack.com/archives/C688QKS7Q/p1609374195254900>

attachments.fallback:
[December 30th, 2020 4:23 PM] markkitt: ```error during bootstrap:
LoadError("sysimg.jl", 3, LoadError("Base.jl", 226, LoadError("version.jl", 245, ArgumentError("invalid version string: "))))
parse at .\version.jl:126 [inlined]
VersionNumber at .\version.jl:130```
How do I fix this? Looks like something is wrong with `libllvm_version_string`
attachments.text:
```error during bootstrap:
LoadError("sysimg.jl", 3, LoadError("Base.jl", 226, LoadError("version.jl", 245, ArgumentError("invalid version string: "))))
parse at .\version.jl:126 [inlined]
VersionNumber at .\version.jl:130```
How do I fix this? Looks like something is wrong with `libllvm_version_string`

elements.text: I wish I could figure out how to build it, but I think there is some issue with the LLVM artifact on Windows.
